result.execSummary:
The defendant Christian P. Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  The Defendant is to complete the Domestic Violence Intervention Program.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment.  The Defendant is to have no contact with F.S. - direct, indirect, in writing, by computer or social media, at residence or work.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol (can be in restaurant, but not the bar area).  Anything regarding child visitation must have approval by Agent.  The Defendant is not to have possession of any weapons/firearms and not to have any in his home.  The Defendant is to continue mental health counseling and any follow up treatment.  Agent is to analyze any computer use for work.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christian P. Robles
